Instantiate a Global Admin objectÂ¶

class GlobalAdmin(host[, port = 443][, https = True])Â¶
Parameters

  • host (str) â The fully qualified domain name, hostname or an IPv4 address of the Gateway

  • port (int) â Set a custom port number (0 - 65535), defaults to 443

  • https (bool) â Set to False to use HTTP, defaults to True

admin = GlobalAdmin('chopin.ctera.com') # will use HTTPS over port 443

Warning

for any certificate related error, this library will prompt for your consent in order to proceed. to avoid the prompt, you may configure chopin-core to automatically trust the serverâs certificate, using: config.http['ssl'] = 'Trust'

Logging inÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.test()Â¶

Verification check to ensure the target host is a Portal.

admin.test()
GlobalAdmin.login(username, password)Â¶

Login to CTERA Portal as a Global Administrator.

Parameters

  • username (str) â username

  • password (str) â password

admin.login('admin', 'G3neralZ0d!')
GlobalAdmin.logout()Â¶

Logout from CTERA Portal.

admin.logout()
GlobalAdmin.whoami()Â¶

Return the name of the logged in user.

Returns

the name of the logged in user

Return type

str

admin.whoami()

NavigatingÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.browse_global_admin()Â¶

Browse the Global Administration Portal.

admin.browse_global_admin()

GlobalAdmin.browse_tenant(name)Â¶
Parameters

name â a Virtual Portal name

Browse a Team Portal.

admin.browse_tenant('chopin')

Core MethodsÂ¶

Print a Portal schema object as a JSON string.

GlobalAdmin.show_multi(paths)Â¶

Print one or more Portal schema objects as a JSON string.

Retrieve a Portal schema object as a Python object.

GlobalAdmin.get_multi(path, paths)Â¶

Retrieve one or more Portal schema objects as a Python object.

GlobalAdmin.put(path, value)Â¶

Update a Portal schema object or attribute.

GlobalAdmin.execute(path, name[, param = None])Â¶

Execute a Portal schema object method.

GlobalAdmin.query(path, params, startFrom, countLimit)Â¶
GlobalAdmin.show_query(path, params, startFrom, countLimit)Â¶

PortalsÂ¶

Retrieve PortalsÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.tenants()Â¶

Retrieve a list of Virtual Portals

Returns

a list of virtual portals

for tenant in admin.tenants():

    print(tenant.name, tenant.usedStorageQuota, tenant.totalStorageQuota)

Create a Team PortalÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.add_tenant(name[, display_name = None][, billing_id = None][, company = None])Â¶

Create a Team Portal.

Parameters

  • name (str) â name of the Team Portal

  • display_name (str) â display name

  • billing_id (str) â a billing id

  • company (str) â company

Returns

a relative url path to the Team Portal

Return type

str

"""Create a Team Portal"""

admin.add_tenant('acme')

"""Create a Team Portal, including a display name, billing id and a company name"""

admin.add_tenant('ctera', 'CTERA', 'Tz9YRDSd8LNfaouzr3Db', 'CTERA Networks')

Delete a Team Portal.

Parameters

name (str) â name of the Team Portal

admin.delete_tenant('acme')

Recover a Team PortalÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.undelete_tenant(name)Â¶

Recover a Team Portal.

Parameters

name (str) â name of the Team Portal

admin.undelete_tenant('acme')

ServersÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.servers([include = ['name']])Â¶

Retrieve the servers that comprise CTERA Portal.

Parameters

include (list) â a list of attributes you wish to retrieve

Returns

a list of server objects

Return type

list

To retrieve servers, you must first browse the Global Administration Portal, using: GlobalAdmin.browse_global_admin()

"""Retrieve all servers"""

servers = admin.servers() # will only retrieve the server name

for server in servers:

    print(server.name)

"""Retrieve multiple server attributes"""

servers = admin.servers(include = ['name', 'connected', 'isApplicationServer', 'mainDB'])

for server in servers:

    print(server)

UsersÂ¶

Local UsersÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.local_users([include = []])Â¶

Retrieve local user accounts.

Parameters

include (list[str]) â a list of user attributes you wish to retrieve

Returns

a list of user objects

Return type

list

The local_users method will always retrieve the name attribute

users = admin.local_users()

for user in users:

    print(user.name)

users = admin.local_users(include = ['name', 'email', 'firstName', 'lastName'])

for user in users:

    print(user)
GlobalAdmin.add_user(username, email, first_name, last_name, password[, role = Role.EndUser][, company = None][, comment = None])Â¶

Add a Portal user.

Parameters

  • username (str) â username

  • email (str) â e-mail address

  • first_name (str) â first name

  • last_name (str) â last name

  • password (str) â password

  • role (str) â role

  • company (str) â company

  • comment (str) â comment

"""Create an end user"""

admin.add_user('bruce', 'bruce.wayne@we.com', 'Bruce', 'Wayne', 'G0th4amCity!')
GlobalAdmin.delete_user(username)Â¶

Delete a Portal user.

Parameters

username (str) â username

"""Delete a local user"""

admin.delete_user('bruce')

Domain UsersÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.domains()Â¶

Retrieve the list of Active Directory domains.

Returns

a list of fully qualified domain names

Return type

list

GlobalAdmin.domain_users(domain[, include = []])Â¶

Retrieve domain users.

Parameters

  • domain (str) â the fully qualified domain name

  • include (list[str]) â the list of user attributes you wish to retrieve

Returns

a list of domain user objects

Return type

list

The domain_users method will always include the name attribute

users = admin.domain_users('domain.ctera.local') # will only retrieve the 'name' attribute

for user in users:

    print(user.name)

"""Retrieve additional user attributes"""

users = admin.domain_users('domain.ctera.local', include = ['name', 'email', 'firstName', 'lastName'])

print(user)

Fetch Users & GroupsÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.fetch(tuples)Â¶

Fetch Active Directory domain users and groups.

Parameters

tuples â list of 3-tuple domain user or group entries

Returns

a path to a Portal background task

Return type

string

DevicesÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.device(name[, include = []])Â¶
Parameters

  • name (str) â device name

  • include (list[str]) â list of device attributes you wish to retrieve

Returns

a device object

Return type

Object, Gateway or Agent

GlobalAdmin.filers([include = []][, allPortals = False][, deviceTypes = None])Â¶
Parameters

  • include (list[str]) â list of Gateway attributes you wish to retrieve

  • allPortals (bool) â whether to retrieve Gateways from all virtual portals, defaults to False

  • deviceTypes (list[str]) â list of Gateway device types, defaults to None

Returns

an interable list of Gateway objects

Return type

list

The filers method will always retrieve the following Gateway attributes: name, deviceType, portal. You may use the include parameter to include additional attributes. To retrieve Gateways from all Portals, you must first browse the Global Administration Portal, using: GlobalAdmin.browse_global_admin() and then set allPortals = True. To filter specific device types, use the deviceTypes parameter as follows: deviceTypes = ['C200', 'C800P']

"""Retrieve all Gateways from the current tenant"""

filers = admin.filers()

for filer in filers:

    print(filer.name) # will print the Gateway name

"""Retrieve additional Gateway attributes"""

filers = admin.filers(['owner', 'deviceConnectionStatus'])

"""Retrieve nested attributes using the '.' delimiter"""

filers = admin.filers(['deviceReportedStatus.status.device.runningFirmware'])

"""Retrieve filers from all portals"""

admin.browse_global_admin()

filers = admin.filers(allPortals = True)

"""Retrieve C200's and C400's from all portals"""

admin.browse_global_admin()

filers = admin.filers(allPortals = True, deviceTypes = ['C200', 'C400'])
GlobalAdmin.agents([include = []][, allPortals = False])Â¶
Parameters

  • include (list[str]) â list of Agent attributes you wish to retrieve

  • allPortals (bool) â whether to retrieve Agents from all virtual portals, defaults to False

Returns

an interable list of Agent objects

Return type

list

The agents method will always retrieve the following Agent attributes: name, deviceType, portal. You may use the include parameter to include additional attributes. To retrieve Agents from all Portals, you must first browse the Global Administration Portal, using: GlobalAdmin.browse_global_admin() and then set allPortals = True. To filter specific device types, use the deviceType parameter as follows: deviceType = 'Server' or deviceType = 'Workstation'

"""Retrieve all Agents from the current tenant"""

agents = admin.agents()

for agent in agents:

    print(agent.name) # will print the Agent name

"""Retrieve all Agents and the underlying OS name"""

agents = admin.agents(['deviceReportedStatus.status.agent.details.osName'])
GlobalAdmin.server_agents([include = []][, allPortals = False])Â¶

Retrieve server agents.

server_agents = admin.server_agents()
GlobalAdmin.desktop_agents([include = []][, allPortals = False])Â¶

Retrieve workstation agents.

desktop_agents = admin.desktop_agents()
GlobalAdmin.devices_by_name(names[, include = []])Â¶

Retrieve devices by name.

Generate Activation CodesÂ¶

GlobalAdmin.generate_code(user[, tenant = None])Â¶

Generate a device activation code.

Parameters

  • user (str) â user name

  • tenant (str) â a virtual portal name, defaults to None

This method will attempt to generate an activation code for user user in portal portal.

"""Generate a device activation code"""

code = admin.generate_code('bruce') # will look for 'bruce' in the current tenant

code = admin.generate_code('batman', 'gotham') # will look for 'bruce' in the gotham tenant

Note

Read Write Administrator, granted with the âSuper Userâ role permission, can generate 200 codes every 5 minutes

generate_code(self, username, tenant = None)

Code SnippetsÂ¶

Generate activation codes for all domain users

# ... login ...

users = admin.domain_users('dc.ctera.local') # obtain a list of domain users

for user in users:

    activation_code = admin.generate_code(user.name) # generate activation code

    print((user.name, activation_code))

# ... logout ...

ZonesÂ¶

To manage zones, you must be a Read Write Administrator

Retrieving the Zones Class ObjectÂ¶

admin = GlobalAdmin('chopin.ctera.com')

admin.login('USERNAME', 'PASSWORD')

zones = admin.zones() # returns a instance of Zones class object

Retrieve a ZoneÂ¶

Zones.get(name)Â¶

Retrieve a zone.

Parameters

name (str) â zone name

zone = zones.get('ZN-001')

Create a ZoneÂ¶

Zones.add(name[, policy_type = 'Select'][, description = None])Â¶

Create a zone.

Parameters

  • name (str) â zone name

  • policy_type (str) â the policy type, defaults to 'Select'

  • description (str) â description

"""
Policy Types:
- All: Include all cloud folders
- Select: Select one or more cloud folders to include
- None: Create an empty zone
"""

"""Create a zone with a description"""

zones.add('ZN-NYS-001', description = 'The New York State Zone')

"""Create a zone and include all folders"""

zones.add('ZN-NYS-002', 'All', 'All Folders')

"""Create an empty zone"""

zones.add('ZN-NYS-003', 'None', 'Empty Zone')

Add Folders to a ZoneÂ¶

Zones.add_folders(name, tuples)Â¶

Add devices to a zone.

Parameters

  • name (str) â zone name

  • tuples (list(tuple(str, str), ..)) â a list of 2-tuple cloud folder entries (folder, owner)

"""
Add the following cloud folders to zone: 'ZN-001'

1) 'Accounting' folder owned by 'Bruce'
2) 'HR' folder owned by 'Diana'

"""

zones.add_folders('ZN-001', [('Accounting', 'Bruce'), ('HR', 'Diana')])

Add Devices to a ZoneÂ¶

Zones.add_devices(name, devices)Â¶

Add devices to a zone.

Parameters

  • name (str) â zone name

  • devices (list(str)) â a list of device names

zones.add_devices('ZN-001', ['vGateway-01ba', 'vGateway-bd02'])

Delete a ZoneÂ¶

Zones.delete(name)Â¶

Delete a zone.

Parameters

name (str) â zone name

zones.delete('ZN-001')

CloudFSÂ¶

To manage the Cloud File System, folder groups, backup and cloud drive folders, you must be a Read Write Administrator

Retrieving the CloudFS Class ObjectÂ¶

admin = GlobalAdmin('chopin.ctera.com')

admin.login('USERNAME', 'PASSWORD')

cloudfs = admin.cloudfs() # returns a instance of CloudFS class object

Create a Folder GroupÂ¶

CloudFS.mkfg(name[, user = None])Â¶

Create a folder group.

Parameters

  • name (str) â folder group name

  • user (str) â owner, defaults to None

cloudfs.mkfg('FG-001', 'svc_account')

cloudfs.mkfg('FG-002') # without an owner

Delete a Folder GroupÂ¶

CloudFS.rmfg(name)Â¶

Delete a folder group.

Parameters

name (str) â folder group name

cloudfs.rmfg('FG-002')

Create a Cloud Drive FolderÂ¶

CloudFS.mkdir(name, group, owner[, winacls = True])Â¶

Create a cloud drive folder.

Parameters

  • name (str) â cloud drive folder name

  • group (str) â folder group name

  • user (str) â user name (owner)

  • winacls (bool) â enable Windows ACLâs, defaults to True

cloudfs.mkdir('DIR-001', 'FG-001', 'svc_account')

cloudfs.mkdir('DIR-002', 'FG-001', 'svc_account', winacls = False) # disable Windows ACL's

Delete a Cloud Drive FolderÂ¶

CloudFS.delete(name, owner)Â¶

Delete a cloud drive folder.

Parameters

  • name (str) â cloud drive folder name

  • owner (str) â user name

cloudfs.delete('DIR-001', 'svc_account')

Recover a Cloud Drive FolderÂ¶

CloudFS.undelete(name, owner)Â¶

Recover a deleted cloud drive folder.

Parameters

  • name (str) â cloud drive folder name

  • owner (str) â user name

cloudfs.undelete('DIR-001', 'svc_account')
